title: Demi Moore and daughters dress to the nines for Harper's Bazaar party celebrating memoir Inside Out
text:
Demi Moore is making waves in both Hollywood and the literary world with her revealing memoir Inside Out.

The actress and her book were celebrated Tuesday night with a intimate gathering hosted by Harper's Bazaar and Salvatore Ferragamo in New York City.

She was dressed to the nines in a black and white pantsuit as she arrived at the event with her stunning daughters Rumer and Tallulah.

Mother's daughters: Demi Moore was dressed to the nines in a black and white pantsuit as she arrived Tuesday night at an event for her memoir Inside Out

The 56-year-old posted a snap of the trio serving looks at Spring Place before the event began.

Another snap shows Tallulah playing stylist for her mom, crouching down to adjust her pants.

Moore participated in a conversation about her book with Harper's editor-in-chief Glenda Bailey.

According to WWD, she told Bailey: 'The question that kept coming back to me was how did I get here?

Stylist mode: She posted a snap of Tallulah playing stylist for her mom, crouching down to adjust her pants

Woman of the hour: The actress and her book were celebrated Tuesday night with a intimate gathering hosted by Harper's Bazaar and Salvatore Ferragamo in New York City

'How did I get here from where I started to the life I’ve lived, the people I met, the places I’ve gone? It just didn’t add up. On paper, it made zero sense.'

She added: 'And then the other part of the question was that I had done so much work and my life sort of exploded and I thought how the f*** did I get here? Really that, too, didn’t add up. Everything that I had put myself into was just crumbling.

'So that really gave me a shape of how to share this part of my story because it’s a memoir, not an autobiography.'

Intimate gathering: It concluded with an intimate candle-lit dinner, also attended by Donna Karan and Ferragamo creative director Paul Andrew

It concluded with an intimate candle-lit dinner, also attended by Donna Karan and Ferragamo creative director Paul Andrew.
